error.signature: endpoint with name already exists in network

verdict.summary: A container with the same name is already connected to the target network. This often happens after a container crash or forced removal that left a stale network endpoint.

dead_ends.action: Deleting and recreating the entire Docker network
dead_ends.why_fails: All other containers on that network lose connectivity and must be reconnected

dead_ends.action: Renaming the container to avoid the conflict
dead_ends.why_fails: The stale endpoint still occupies the network slot; the old endpoint must be cleaned up

workarounds.action: Disconnect the stale endpoint from the network first
workarounds.how: docker network disconnect -f <network> <container-name> && docker network connect <network> <container-name>

workarounds.action: Remove the dead container and restart with docker compose up
workarounds.how: docker rm -f <container-name> && docker compose up -d â€” Compose will recreate the container with a fresh network endpoint

leads_to.condition: when trying to remove a network with stale endpoints

preceded_by.condition: when a container fails to stop cleanly, leaving orphaned network endpoints

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Endpoint exists means a specific container's endpoint is stale on a network, while active endpoints means the network itself cannot be removed because containers are still connected
